snippet.title: Eternal Darkness creator seeking crowdfunding for spiritual sequel
snippet.description: ...It's been almost 11 years since Eternal Darkness: Sanity's Requiem became the first M-rated game published by Nintendo, but to this day fans talk reverently about the GameCube cult classic's rich mythos and mind-bending "insanity effects." Now, Eternal Darkness director Dennis Dyack is trying to bring that magic back with plans to attract crowdfunding for a spiritual succ...

snippet.title: Dark Knight Blu-ray scratches surface of BD-Live potential
snippet.description: ...The Dark Knight was a huge theatrical release, and Warner Bros. is hoping its just as large a success on DVD and Blu-ray. The disc release is special for Warner as well: this is the first Blu-ray disc the studio has released that supports all the BD-Live extras available from players that support...
